definitions: forceful or illegal demand for money through threats or intimidation
thorough search of premises or person for contraband or evidence
test run or trial period to identify problems in equipment or procedures
examples: The business owner reported the shakedown attempt to the police immediately
Local gangs ran shakedown operations against vulnerable shop owners
Prison guards conducted a shakedown of every cell looking for weapons
The border patrol shakedown revealed hidden compartments in the vehicle
The ship's shakedown cruise identified several mechanical issues needing repair
We need a proper shakedown period before launching the production line

definitions: container with perforated lid for dispensing or mixing liquids and powders
member of religious sect known for ecstatic worship involving trembling movements
person who creates significant change or influence in their field
examples: The bartender reached for the cocktail shaker to mix the martini
Pass the salt shaker from across the dining table please
The Shaker community built simple, functional furniture that remains highly valued
Shaker religious practices included communal living and celibacy
She's a real mover and shaker in the technology industry
The conference attracted all the movers and shakers from Wall Street

definitions: rapid back-and-forth or up-and-down movement causing vibration or tremor
state of being emotionally disturbed, upset, or traumatized by events
examples: The shaking of the building during the earthquake lasted thirty seconds
His hands showed visible shaking from the Parkinson's disease
The accident left her with severe emotional shaking that required counseling
News of the layoffs caused considerable shaking among the remaining staff

definitions: fine-grained sedimentary rock formed from compressed mud and clay layers
geological formation containing oil and gas extracted through hydraulic fracturing
examples: The cliff face revealed distinct layers of gray shale and sandstone
Geologists identified shale formations dating back millions of years
Shale oil extraction has transformed North America's energy production significantly
The company invested heavily in shale gas drilling operations

definitions: area of water with little depth between surface and bottom
quality of lacking depth, substance, or intellectual complexity
examples: Children can safely play in the shallows near the beach
The boat ran aground in the shallows during low tide
His analysis revealed the shallows of their supposed expertise
Don't mistake her quietness for intellectual shallows

definitions: something false or fake presented as genuine to deceive others
decorative pillow cover used on beds for aesthetic purposes only
examples: The investigation revealed the charity was a complete sham
Their marriage turned out to be a sham for immigration purposes
She arranged the shams carefully against the headboard each morning
The bedding set included two shams matching the comforter pattern

definitions: person believed to have access to the spirit world through trance states
traditional healer using rituals and natural remedies in indigenous cultures
examples: The tribal shaman performed healing ceremonies for the sick villagers
Many cultures recognize shamans as intermediaries between physical and spiritual realms
The shaman prepared herbal remedies passed down through generations
Local people still consult the shaman for important life decisions

definitions: religious practice involving practitioners reaching altered states to interact with spirit world
traditional healing system using rituals, herbs, and spiritual intervention
examples: Shamanism remains an important spiritual practice in many indigenous communities
Anthropologists have studied shamanism across diverse cultures worldwide
Modern practitioners blend shamanism with contemporary therapeutic approaches
The workshop introduced participants to basic shamanism healing techniques

definitions: painful feeling of humiliation caused by consciousness of wrong or foolish behavior
loss of respect or honor bringing disgrace to person or group
regrettable or disappointing situation that could have been avoided
examples: She felt deep shame about lying to her parents
His face burned with shame when caught cheating
The scandal brought shame upon the entire organization
They tried to hide their financial shame from neighbors
It's a shame the concert was cancelled due to rain
What a shame you missed the surprise party yesterday

definitions: liquid soap formulated specifically for washing hair and scalp
act or process of washing hair with specialized cleaning product
cleaning product or service for washing carpets and upholstery
examples: This shampoo contains natural ingredients for sensitive scalps
She switched to sulfate-free shampoo for healthier hair
The salon includes a relaxing shampoo with every haircut service
Give your hair a thorough shampoo before applying the treatment
We hired professionals for a deep carpet shampoo after the party
The shampoo machine removed years of embedded dirt

definitions: small plant with three leaves, typically referring to clover species
traditional symbol of Ireland associated with Saint Patrick and Irish heritage
examples: The field was covered with tiny shamrocks after spring rains
Children searched for four-leaf shamrocks hoping for good luck
People wear shamrock pins on Saint Patrick's Day celebrations
The shamrock appears on many Irish organizations' emblems

definitions: beverage made by mixing beer with lemonade or ginger beer
examples: He ordered a refreshing shandy on the hot summer afternoon
The pub serves traditional British shandies with various beer options

definitions: lower part of leg between knee and ankle in humans or animals
connecting part of tool between handle and working end
cut of meat from upper leg portion of animal
golf shot hit incorrectly with club's hosel causing sideways flight
examples: The horse injured its shank during the race yesterday
His shank bore old scars from years of hard labor
The drill bit's shank fits into the chuck securely
Check that the shank is properly seated before operating
The butcher recommended lamb shank for the stew recipe
Braised beef shank becomes tender after slow cooking
His shank shot went straight into the water hazard
Even professionals occasionally shank shots under pressure

definitions: roughly built shack or cabin typically in poor areas
rhythmic work song traditionally sung by sailors while performing tasks
examples: Makeshift shanties lined the outskirts of the city
The old fishing shanty stood abandoned by the harbor
Sailors sang sea shanties while hauling the anchor chains
The maritime museum features recordings of traditional shanties

definitions: external outline or contour of an object or figure
physical fitness or health condition of person or thing
overall condition, state, or circumstances of situation or enterprise
examples: The cloud formed an unusual shape against the sunset
Children learn to identify basic shapes in kindergarten
She's in excellent shape after months of training
The old car is still in decent shape mechanically
The economy is in better shape than last quarter
We need to get our finances back into shape

definitions: machine or tool used to cut, mold, or form materials into specific shapes
person who influences or determines the development of something significant
examples: The woodworker used a shaper to create decorative moldings
This body shaper helps create a smoother silhouette
She's recognized as a key shaper of modern educational policy
Tech innovators are the shapers of our digital future

definitions: process of giving form or structure to materials or objects
act of influencing or determining the development of ideas, policies, or character
examples: The shaping of clay requires patience and skilled hands
Metal shaping involves heating and hammering techniques
Her early experiences were crucial in shaping her worldview
Technology is rapidly shaping modern communication patterns

definitions: sharp piece of broken glass, pottery, or other brittle material
examples: Archaeologists carefully excavated ancient pottery shards from the site
Glass shards from the accident scattered across the highway

definitions: part or portion of something divided among multiple people
unit of ownership in company representing claim on assets and earnings
act of distributing content on social media platforms to others
examples: Everyone deserves their fair share of the inheritance
She did more than her share of the household chores
He bought shares in several technology companies last year
The company's shares rose ten percent after earnings report
Her post received thousands of shares within hours
Click the share button to spread this important message

definitions: person who owns shares in a company and has claim on its assets and profits
examples: Shareholders voted against the proposed merger at yesterday's meeting
Major shareholders demanded changes to the board of directors

definitions: quantity of shares owned by individual or entity in a company
examples: His shareholding in the company exceeded twenty percent
The family's shareholding gave them controlling interest

definitions: software distributed free for trial period before requiring payment for continued use
examples: Many small developers distribute their programs as shareware initially
The shareware version has limited features until you register

definitions: religious law forming part of Islamic tradition derived from religious precepts
examples: The court applies sharia principles in family law matters
Different countries interpret sharia law in various ways

definitions: alternative spelling of sharia, the religious law of Islam
examples: The bank offers shariah-compliant financial products
Shariah councils provide guidance on religious matters

definitions: act of dividing something among multiple people or using jointly
economic model based on shared access to goods and services
examples: Sharing toys teaches children important social skills
The sharing of resources reduced costs for everyone
The sharing economy includes services like ride-sharing and home-sharing
Bike sharing programs have expanded in urban areas

definitions: large predatory fish with cartilaginous skeleton and rows of sharp teeth
person who preys on others through deception or aggressive business practices
examples: The great white shark circled the diving cage menacingly
Scientists tagged sharks to study their migration patterns
Watch out for loan sharks offering easy money solutions
He's a corporate shark who destroys smaller companies

definitions: musical note raised by a half step or semitone above natural pitch
examples: The pianist missed the F sharp in the difficult passage
This key signature has three sharps

definitions: person who cheats or swindles others, especially at cards or gambling
examples: The card sharper was banned from every casino in town
Old West stories often featured sharpers fleeing angry victims

definitions: person highly skilled in shooting, especially with rifles at long distances
examples: Military sharpshooters provided cover for advancing troops
The police sharpshooter neutralized the threat from a rooftop

definitions: process of breaking suddenly into many pieces with force
emotional or psychological devastation causing complete disruption of composure
examples: The shattering of glass echoed through the empty building
Protective film prevents dangerous shattering of car windows
The shattering of her dreams left her deeply depressed
News of his death was absolutely shattering for the family

definitions: act of removing hair with razor or similar cutting implement
very thin slice or layer removed from surface
narrow escape from danger or unpleasant situation
examples: His morning shave takes exactly ten minutes every day
She scheduled a professional shave at the barber shop
Add a shave of parmesan cheese to the salad
Wood shaves covered the workshop floor
That was a close shave with the speeding truck
We had a close shave with bankruptcy last year

definitions: electric or manual device designed for removing facial or body hair
informal term for young boy or youth
examples: His electric shaver needs new blades after six months
The travel shaver fits perfectly in the toiletry bag
The little shaver wants to be just like his father
Young shavers lined up for baseball tryouts

definitions: act or process of removing hair with cutting implement
thin piece of material removed by cutting or scraping
examples: Daily shaving irritates his sensitive skin considerably
The barbershop offers traditional hot towel shaving services
Wood shavings make excellent bedding for small pets
Metal shavings covered the machine shop floor

definitions: piece of fabric worn over shoulders or head for warmth or decoration
examples: Her grandmother's silk shawl became a treasured family heirloom
She wrapped the woolen shawl tightly against the cold

definitions: light two-wheeled carriage drawn by one horse popular in colonial America
examples: The museum displays a restored shay from the 1800s
They rode through town in an old-fashioned shay

definitions: bundle of grain stalks tied together after reaping
collection of papers or similar flat objects held together
examples: Farmers stacked wheat sheaves in the field to dry
The painting depicted workers gathering sheaves at harvest
She carried a sheaf of documents to the meeting
The lawyer produced a sheaf of evidence

definitions: force that causes layers of material to slide past each other
stress causing deformation where parallel planes slide relative to each other
examples: Wind shear poses serious danger to aircraft during landing
The bolt failed due to excessive shear forces
Engineers calculated the shear stress on the bridge supports
Metal undergoes shear when subjected to opposing parallel forces

definitions: person who cuts wool from sheep using hand or powered shears
large machine used in mining to cut coal from seam face
examples: Experienced shearers can process hundreds of sheep daily
The shearer worked quickly through the flock
The coal shearer advanced steadily along the mine face
Modern shearers increase mining efficiency significantly

definitions: process of cutting wool from sheep or other animals
mechanical deformation where material layers slide past each other
examples: Spring shearing helps sheep stay cool in summer
The shearing shed bustled with activity
Metal shearing requires specialized cutting equipment
Shearing forces caused the structural failure

definitions: large scissors or cutting tool with two blades for cutting various materials
examples: Garden shears make pruning bushes much easier
The tailor's shears cut through heavy fabric smoothly

definitions: close-fitting cover for blade of knife or sword
straight, close-fitting dress without defined waistline
examples: He slid the knife back into its leather sheath
The sword's ornate sheath displayed intricate engravings
She wore an elegant black sheath to the cocktail party
The sheath dress flatters many body types

definitions: protective covering or casing for cables, pipes, or blades
structural covering material applied to frame of building
examples: Cable sheathing protects wires from moisture and damage
The pipe's sheathing prevents corrosion
Plywood sheathing provides structural support for the walls
Workers installed sheathing before adding the siding

definitions: simple single-story structure used for storage or shelter
structure providing shelter for livestock or farm equipment
natural process of losing hair, skin, or other body covering
examples: Garden tools filled the old wooden shed behind the house
They built a shed to store the lawnmower
Cows gathered in the milking shed each morning
The equipment shed protected tractors from weather
Dogs experience heavy shed during seasonal changes
The snake's shed revealed its recent growth

definitions: natural process of losing hair, feathers, skin, or leaves
act of getting rid of or releasing something, especially emotions
examples: Spring shedding leaves pet hair throughout the house
The tree's shedding of leaves signals autumn's arrival
The therapy session involved shedding years of suppressed anger
Shedding old habits takes time and patience

definitions: soft luster or shine on a surface reflecting light gently
examples: The silk fabric had a beautiful sheen in the sunlight
Polish gave the car's paint a brilliant sheen

definitions: domesticated ruminant animal raised for wool, meat, and milk
person who follows others without thinking independently
examples: The shepherd moved his sheep to fresh pasture
Sheep provide wool for the textile industry
Don't be sheep following every social media trend
The dictator viewed citizens as sheep to control

definitions: dog bred and trained to herd, guard, or work with sheep
examples: The border collie sheepdog expertly guided the flock
Their sheepdog protected lambs from predators

definitions: marine fish with sheep-like teeth found in Atlantic coastal waters
trick-taking card game played primarily in Wisconsin
examples: Anglers prize sheepshead for their fighting ability and taste
The sheepshead's human-like teeth help crush shellfish
Friday night sheepshead games are tradition at the tavern
Learning sheepshead requires understanding trump cards

definitions: leather or pelt from sheep with wool still attached or removed
informal term for diploma or academic degree certificate
examples: The sheepskin rug added warmth to the bedroom floor
Pilots wear sheepskin-lined boots for high-altitude flights
After four years, she finally earned her sheepskin
The sheepskin on his wall proved his medical credentials

definitions: large rectangular piece of fabric used as bedding
thin flat piece of material like paper, metal, or glass
broad continuous surface or expanse of water, ice, or flame
examples: Fresh sheets made the guest bedroom welcoming
The fitted sheet wouldn't stay on the mattress
Sign your name on this sheet of paper
Workers installed sheet metal on the roof
Rain came down in sheets during the storm
The lake froze into a solid sheet of ice
